title: BTS as dads.
body:
pairing: bangtan x reader  
fandom: bts
warnings: language
genre: fluff ; angst ; crack
previous: x ; x

a/n: aaah omfg, it literally took me so long to write the last part for this series. I’m so sorry! but here it finally is! I hope you like it ♥

ask box | masterlist | fandoms | faq | multifandom reader blog

kim seokjin

“What are you googling?” he placed his chin on your head, furrowing his eyebrows when he saw your search, “'How to make your son eat something other than waffles’?”

“You’d be surprised how many mothers have the same question as me,” Jin turned his head to his one and a half year old, sitting in his high chair in the kitchen and munching happily on his waffles, completely oblivious to the fact that his parents were even in the room, “It’s not even that I want him to eat carrots, even though I’d be more than happy if he wanted something healthy for once. It’s just that he won’t eat ANYTHING other than waffles. It’s like me when I was pregnant with him.”

“Only that you craved eggs and made me make you fried eggs at 3 in the morning.”

“Well, you were the one that got me pregnant, so…”

He grinned and kissed your forehead, before walking over to his son and crouching down in front of him.

“Jonwoo, do you want me to show you something really cool?” Your son looked up from his waffles and wanted to shove a piece of it into his father’s mouth, but Jin quickly got up and shook his head. “Here.. I’ll show you something.”

You watched him with curious eyes as he pulled several things out of the fridge and began randomly shoving them onto a skewer.

Jonwoo wasn’t interested, still munching on his waffles. Only when Jin pulled a chair towards his son and sat down in front of him, did he raise his head.

“The food that I cook is so good, that it gives you superpowers,” he held up the skewer, his son beginning to get semi-interested, “If you eat my food, it makes you so happy, watch,” he ate the first tomato off of it and munched just as happily as his son had on the waffles, before letting out a loud yum that had your son laugh out loud.

He made funny expressions, shook his head from side to side and eventually, Jonwoo reached for the skewer and began nibbling on the food that was on there.

Jin stood proudly before you, wiggling his eyebrows triumphantly at you, while you only looked at him with your arms crossed in front of your chest and a smirk sitting on your lips.

“Good job. Guess you’re the only one who’s making him dinner from now on, since only YOUR food has superpowers and not mommy’s.”

Ah well.. his plan had almost been perfect.

min yoongi

Yoongi was just so fucking tired.

His son had been up all night and even though you had tried to calm him down, a tummy ache was keeping him up till 5 AM. Normally that wouldn’t be too bad, he’d just take it easy the next day, but they were having a performance today.

And to say he was running on caffeine would be an understatement, because he couldn’t even remember how many coffees he has actually had.

“You okay?” Namjoon knelt down in front of his friend and band member, putting his hand on his shoulder.

“Yeah, yeah, I’m fine,” he mumbled.

He tried to focus on what Namjoon and the others said, but he could barely keep his eyes open, much less focus on anything other than staying awake.

And then that little monster (even if he loved him with all his heart) actually had the audacity to showed up.

“DADDY!” he ran towards him with his tiny feet and jumped into his arms.

“What are you..-” he looked up at you, who looked just as bad and exhausted as he did, maybe even a little worse, since you were always the one getting up in the middle of the night.

“He wanted to see you perform.”

“Did you not think you should have told me that?” he got up from the floor and grabbed your arm, pulling you to a secluded area, “There’s going to be cameras everywhere.”

“Yoongi..,” you smiled sweetly at him, but he could tell that it was fake, your lids dangerously close to dropping, “I haven’t had a good night’s rest in more than 72 hours. I can’t deal with a crying toddler right now. So if he wants to see daddy, he’s going to see daddy.”

“Fine,” he sighed, “But stay backstage and don’t let him come anywhere near the cameras!”

“Yes, Sir.”

“And don’t say Sir when we’re not alone, you know what that does to me,” he hissed under his breath, “Or do you want to have another one of these?”

As tired as you were, the sight of your son cuddled against his father’s chest actually did made you want to have a second one.. but maybe when he was older.. and not keeping you up as long as he did now.

jung hoseok

Hope and you had just arrived at the fan sign, standing all the way in the back as to not pull too much attention towards you.

“Can you see daddy?” you whispered and she proudly pointed at Hoseok, “Good job, baby.”

You three wanted to grab lunch together, but you hadn’t known when he was actually done here, so you decided to go in and just watch for a while, show Hope how many people loved her father.

It took Hoseok around five minutes before his eyes finally landed on you two, his entire face immediately lighting up.

Hope waved happily at him, her smile exactly the same as his and just as big.

“Can I go to daddy?”

“No, love, he’s still working. You can go to him when he’s done.”

“Oh,” she began to pout and then her lower lip began trembling and you knew that if you didn’t do something quickly, she’d end up sobbing in here and that was the last thing you wanted. It wasn’t that she was bratty, Hope had never been that. It was just that her father meant everything to her. Literally. So when she was so close to him, but wasn’t allowed to get hugs and kisses? That hurt her..

As if one look towards your boyfriend was enough, he immediately understood and began making hearts and funny faces for his kid and it didn’t take more then ten seconds, before she was laughing wholeheartedly again.

And when she was finally allowed to run to him and get the kisses and hugs she so desperately wanted, the world was fine again.

“You were so good today, baby.”

“I didn’t cry!” she said proudly.

“I saw that! You made mommy and daddy super proud,” he tickled her, before leaning towards you and pressing a kiss against your lips.

“Thank you,” you mouthed and he winked at you.

That was the definition of teamwork.

kim namjoon

This was your first Christmas as parents, spending the holidays (or at least a couple of days) at Namjoons’ parents house, before you’d have to go back to Seoul, since he had to work again.

Most of his family was already in bed, after having stuffed themselves to the brim with how much his mother had cooked for everyone. All but Namjoon, who was sitting in front of the fireplace with a book in his hand, enjoying the rare quietness that being a father had taken away from him.

Not that he minded.

Of course balancing out the life of an idol, as well as a father was hard and stressful and even though he had been worried about it beforehand, he wouldn’t change his life for anything now. He now had a beautiful son that made his life a lot better and ever since two months ago, not just a girlfriend, but a fiance that he loved with all his heart.

Speaking of fiance.

“You should come to bed,” you smiled as you walked towards him with your oversized shirt (that was actually his), some shorts and fuzzy socks. A look that always made him fall in love all over again with you. You were holding your sleeping son in your arms, as you sat down in his lap, leaning against him

“Did he wake up again?”

“He was hungry,” you gently brushed over your baby’s soft cheek, “You’d think after your mother fed him so much he’d be good for a couple of hours.”

Namjoon laughed and pressed a kiss against your head, “He’s got a good appetite, I guess.”

For a moment, neither of you said anything. The only sound in the room was the crackling fire and the soft breathing of your son.

“Namjoon?” you asked after a while.

“Hm?”

“I want another baby.”

“What?” he let out a soft laugh, “What do you mean another one? We just had one.”

“I know.. and it’s probably stupid, but.. he’s growing up so fast..”

“(Y/N),” he began, “I want to have a big family with you, you know that. But I’m already missing out so much on his life.. I don’t want that to happen with our second child as well. I want to be there for you, every step of the way this time. And I don’t want to see my next kid grow up through my phone screen as well. It’s hard enough doing it now..”

You knew he was right. How hard it was for him to miss out on so much, just because he was away on tour or doing god knows what.

You were being selfish here.. you needed to wait, so that he could experience it all with you again. That was his right and you wouldn’t take that from him.. as much as you wanted to have another baby with him.

“I’m sorry.. you’re right.”

“We will have another baby.. just.. not now.”

“Okay..”

park jimin

Since his daughter was finally big enough to do stuff, you know, other than crying and pooping, he decided that this mother’s day, he’d finally bake a cake with her for you.

So he told you to stay in bed when the little one woke up, took her to the kitchen to have breakfast and then began baking with her.

Not that he had any idea on how to do it, but he had asked Jin beforehand, who had given him not only tips, but a recipe as well.

And to his surprise, his daughter actually did way better than himself and much better than he had expected.

She was the boss in the kitchen, telling him what to do and where to go and tried to most of it herself, already.

To say he was a proud father would not be enough. And after this, he was sure she’d be a cook one day.

“Here, daddy,” she held out a bowl, “Try it.”

He thought he’d have to fake it and tell her it was good when it actually wasn’t. Isn’t that what all parents did? When their kids drew paintings that looked horrible, they just smiled and said: ‘Good job!’. He was fully prepared to do the same thing, but then he actually tasted it and was amazed at how good it was.

He gave her a big thumbs up, “It tastes fantastic!”

She giggled, “Is mommy going to like it?”

“Definitely, love,” he kissed her forehead, “Especially because you made it.”

And so one and a half hours later, he entered your shared bedroom with a cake in his hand and his daughter.

“Mommy,” she whispered, as she sat on your chest, “Mommy wake up..”

“What.. what is it?” you mumbled, your hands on her legs, “Are you okay?”

“It’s mother’s day today! Daddy and I made you cake because we love you so much!” and with that, she cuddled against you, “You’re the best mommy in the world! And my baby brother will be so lucky to have you..”

It should be illegal to be this cute at this early hour, because you fully ended up crying.

Whether that was because of how thankful you were to Jimin and your daughter, or because your son in your belly made your hormones go wild.. who knows.

Jimin leaned down and pressed a kiss against your forehead, “Happy mother’s day to the most beautiful mother in the world.”

“I love you,” you whispered against his lips, “So much..”

“I love you too, Jagi..”

kim taehyung

“Daddy?” your daughter carefully pushed open the bedroom door and Taehyung immediately looked up from his laptop to smile at his daughter, “Can I come in?”

“Hmm..,” he pretended like he was thinking about it while getting up and walking over to her, before quickly picking her up and showering her with kisses, “Hopefully to cuddle?”

She giggled when he fell onto the bed with her, landing on his back, and she tried to wriggle out of his grasp, but he tightly held her in his arms, not wanting to stop kissing his beautiful baby girl just yet.

“Daddy! It’s important!”

“This is too!” he wanted to tickle her tummy, but she managed to jump away from him and suddenly yelled:

“I CUT SANGMIN’S HAIR AND NOW HE’S CRYING.”

That made the smile disappear at once.

“What?”

“Well,” she suddenly got super shy, looking at her hands and fidgeting with her fingers, “We were cutting my dolls hair and then I ran out of dolls..”

“You cut your brother’s hair because you ran out of dolls?! Kim Soyoung!”

“Daddy,” at the touch of a button, his son entered the room, his face red and puffy from all the crying.

This is what happened when you were out for a day and he was left with his twin toddlers. It all went to shit. He still remembered the conversation he and you have had this morning, when he told you to enjoy your day with your girlfriends and that he’d handle everything. And that when you’d come home, everything would be the same it was when you had left. 

And now his son was left with a horrible haircut.

“Show me,” Taehyung winked him over and helped him sit on the bed, inspecting the damage his twin sister had caused. She had cut a bit at the back, but it didn’t look too bad, actually. He had thought he would have half of his hair chopped of. This, he may be able to fix, “It’s not too bad, Sangmin.”

“See? I told you,” one look from her father was enough to have Soyoung stop talking and lower her head in shame once more.

“I’ll tell you what. How about.. we cut daddy’s hair just like that too! And when mommy comes home, she won’t even notice,” of course that wasn’t really what he had planned. He’d cut off a bit of his own hair, but he’d mostly fix what his daughter had caused.

Sangmin nodded, not fully happy with it, but he still cuddled into his father’s chest and let him carry the boy into the bathroom. Soyoung wanted to fix it herself, but he felt like she’d only make it worse if she did. 

And when you got home later that night and your jaw hung open when you saw both your son and husband with a new hairstyle that they clearly cut themselves, he just brushed his hand through the damp strands and nervously licked his lips.

“It’s not too bad, I promise.”

jeon jeongguk

Both you and Jeongguk woke up to the screams of your daughter. For the fourth time this night. The first time, she was hungry, then you had to change her diapers and then she wanted to eat again. But now neither of these two things seemed to be the problem and when she just wouldn’t stop crying, you got out of bed and wanted to walk around the apartment, hoping it would calm her down a bit.

“No.. don’t go,” Jeongguk instantly sat up.

“You need to sleep.”

“You do too.”

You sighed, not having the energy to argue, and laid back down, placing your newborn baby between you two, both you and his hand gently stroking her body.

It’s been two months, and you were both still so utterly lost as parents. You both tried your hardest, but every time something like this happened, you just wanted to cry, because you had no idea what was wrong with her and she obviously couldn’t just tell you.

Despite all, you still loved her both with all your heart. That made it a bit easier.

Suddenly, Jeongguk began humming one of their new songs, while his fingertips brushed over her tiny nose, her forehead and her cheeks. And eventually he began singing.

It was The Truth Untold, but a very, very soft version. He turned it into a lullaby and the second your baby girl heard his voice, she calmed down.

It was like magic.

Her teary eyes were now big, staring up at her father and watching him sing line after line. And she wasn’t the only one entranced. You were too.

And while your daughter stopped crying, you were the one that started, even though quietly. Because you were just so.. exhausted and stressed. You thought everything you were doing was wrong and you were a horrible mother. You thought that maybe you should have given her up and she would have had a better life, because you just didn’t seem to be doing anything right, as much as you tried. But through all of it, Jeongguk stayed by your side. Even though his busy schedule should have him sleep most of the day if he had free time, he spent the day with you and your daughter. He always made sure that you were both alright and he never complained about anything.

Not once.

And it was moments like these that it all came crashing down and you just couldn’t keep it together anymore.

While his daughter’s eyes slowly dropped again and he sang her back to sleep, he reached out to you and gently caressed your cheek, wiping away the tears, but never stopping to sing.

And then he ended the song with a gentle: “And I still want you..”

Not that he minded.

Of course balancing out the life of an idol, as well as a father was hard and stressful and even though he had been worried about it beforehand, he wouldn’t change his life for anything now. He now had a beautiful son that made his life a lot better and ever since two months ago, not just a girlfriend, but a fiance that he loved with all his heart.

Speaking of fiance.

“You should come to bed,” you smiled as you walked towards him with your oversized shirt (that was actually his), some shorts and fuzzy socks. A look that always made him fall in love all over again with you. You were holding your sleeping son in your arms, as you sat down in his lap, leaning against him

“Did he wake up again?”

“He was hungry,” you gently brushed over your baby’s soft cheek, “You’d think after your mother fed him so much he’d be good for a couple of hours.”

Namjoon laughed and pressed a kiss against your head, “He’s got a good appetite, I guess.”

For a moment, neither of you said anything. The only sound in the room was the crackling fire and the soft breathing of your son.

“Namjoon?” you asked after a while.

“Hm?”

“I want another baby.”

“What?” he let out a soft laugh, “What do you mean another one? We just had one.”

“I know.. and it’s probably stupid, but.. he’s growing up so fast..”

“(Y/N),” he began, “I want to have a big family with you, you know that. But I’m already missing out so much on his life.. I don’t want that to happen with our second child as well. I want to be there for you, every step of the way this time. And I don’t want to see my next kid grow up through my phone screen as well. It’s hard enough doing it now..”

You knew he was right. How hard it was for him to miss out on so much, just because he was away on tour or doing god knows what.

You were being selfish here.. you needed to wait, so that he could experience it all with you again. That was his right and you wouldn’t take that from him.. as much as you wanted to have another baby with him.

“I’m sorry.. you’re right.”

“We will have another baby.. just.. not now.”

“Okay..”

park jimin

Since his daughter was finally big enough to do stuff, you know, other than crying and pooping, he decided that this mother’s day, he’d finally bake a cake with her for you.

So he told you to stay in bed when the little one woke up, took her to the kitchen to have breakfast and then began baking with her.

Not that he had any idea on how to do it, but he had asked Jin beforehand, who had given him not only tips, but a recipe as well.

And to his surprise, his daughter actually did way better than himself and much better than he had expected.

She was the boss in the kitchen, telling him what to do and where to go and tried to most of it herself, already.

To say he was a proud father would not be enough. And after this, he was sure she’d be a cook one day.

“Here, daddy,” she held out a bowl, “Try it.”

He thought he’d have to fake it and tell her it was good when it actually wasn’t. Isn’t that what all parents did? When their kids drew paintings that looked horrible, they just smiled and said: ‘Good job!’. He was fully prepared to do the same thing, but then he actually tasted it and was amazed at how good it was.

He gave her a big thumbs up, “It tastes fantastic!”

She giggled, “Is mommy going to like it?”

“Definitely, love,” he kissed her forehead, “Especially because you made it.”

And so one and a half hours later, he entered your shared bedroom with a cake in his hand and his daughter.

“Mommy,” she whispered, as she sat on your chest, “Mommy wake up..”

“What.. what is it?” you mumbled, your hands on her legs, “Are you okay?”

“It’s mother’s day today! Daddy and I made you cake because we love you so much!” and with that, she cuddled against you, “You’re the best mommy in the world! And my baby brother will be so lucky to have you..”

It should be illegal to be this cute at this early hour, because you fully ended up crying.

Whether that was because of how thankful you were to Jimin and your daughter, or because your son in your belly made your hormones go wild.. who knows.

Jimin leaned down and pressed a kiss against your forehead, “Happy mother’s day to the most beautiful mother in the world.”

“I love you,” you whispered against his lips, “So much..”

“I love you too, Jagi..”

kim taehyung

“Daddy?” your daughter carefully pushed open the bedroom door and Taehyung immediately looked up from his laptop to smile at his daughter, “Can I come in?”

“Hmm..,” he pretended like he was thinking about it while getting up and walking over to her, before quickly picking her up and showering her with kisses, “Hopefully to cuddle?”

She giggled when he fell onto the bed with her, landing on his back, and she tried to wriggle out of his grasp, but he tightly held her in his arms, not wanting to stop kissing his beautiful baby girl just yet.

“Daddy! It’s important!”

“This is too!” he wanted to tickle her tummy, but she managed to jump away from him and suddenly yelled:

“I CUT SANGMIN’S HAIR AND NOW HE’S CRYING.”

That made the smile disappear at once.

“What?”

“Well,” she suddenly got super shy, looking at her hands and fidgeting with her fingers, “We were cutting my dolls hair and then I ran out of dolls..”

“You cut your brother’s hair because you ran out of dolls?! Kim Soyoung!”

“Daddy,” at the touch of a button, his son entered the room, his face red and puffy from all the crying.

This is what happened when you were out for a day and he was left with his twin toddlers. It all went to shit. He still remembered the conversation he and you have had this morning, when he told you to enjoy your day with your girlfriends and that he’d handle everything. And that when you’d come home, everything would be the same it was when you had left. 

And now his son was left with a horrible haircut.

“Show me,” Taehyung winked him over and helped him sit on the bed, inspecting the damage his twin sister had caused. She had cut a bit at the back, but it didn’t look too bad, actually. He had thought he would have half of his hair chopped of. This, he may be able to fix, “It’s not too bad, Sangmin.”

“See? I told you,” one look from her father was enough to have Soyoung stop talking and lower her head in shame once more.

“I’ll tell you what. How about.. we cut daddy’s hair just like that too! And when mommy comes home, she won’t even notice,” of course that wasn’t really what he had planned. He’d cut off a bit of his own hair, but he’d mostly fix what his daughter had caused.

Sangmin nodded, not fully happy with it, but he still cuddled into his father’s chest and let him carry the boy into the bathroom. Soyoung wanted to fix it herself, but he felt like she’d only make it worse if she did. 

And when you got home later that night and your jaw hung open when you saw both your son and husband with a new hairstyle that they clearly cut themselves, he just brushed his hand through the damp strands and nervously licked his lips.

“It’s not too bad, I promise.”

jeon jeongguk

Both you and Jeongguk woke up to the screams of your daughter. For the fourth time this night. The first time, she was hungry, then you had to change her diapers and then she wanted to eat again. But now neither of these two things seemed to be the problem and when she just wouldn’t stop crying, you got out of bed and wanted to walk around the apartment, hoping it would calm her down a bit.

“No.. don’t go,” Jeongguk instantly sat up.

“You need to sleep.”

“You do too.”

You sighed, not having the energy to argue, and laid back down, placing your newborn baby between you two, both you and his hand gently stroking her body.

It’s been two months, and you were both still so utterly lost as parents. You both tried your hardest, but every time something like this happened, you just wanted to cry, because you had no idea what was wrong with her and she obviously couldn’t just tell you.

Despite all, you still loved her both with all your heart. That made it a bit easier.

Suddenly, Jeongguk began humming one of their new songs, while his fingertips brushed over her tiny nose, her forehead and her cheeks. And eventually he began singing.

It was The Truth Untold, but a very, very soft version. He turned it into a lullaby and the second your baby girl heard his voice, she calmed down.

It was like magic.

Her teary eyes were now big, staring up at her father and watching him sing line after line. And she wasn’t the only one entranced. You were too.

And while your daughter stopped crying, you were the one that started, even though quietly. Because you were just so.. exhausted and stressed. You thought everything you were doing was wrong and you were a horrible mother. You thought that maybe you should have given her up and she would have had a better life, because you just didn’t seem to be doing anything right, as much as you tried. But through all of it, Jeongguk stayed by your side. Even though his busy schedule should have him sleep most of the day if he had free time, he spent the day with you and your daughter. He always made sure that you were both alright and he never complained about anything.

Not once.

And it was moments like these that it all came crashing down and you just couldn’t keep it together anymore.

While his daughter’s eyes slowly dropped again and he sang her back to sleep, he reached out to you and gently caressed your cheek, wiping away the tears, but never stopping to sing.

And then he ended the song with a gentle: “And I still want you..”

kim seokjin

“What are you googling?” he placed his chin on your head, furrowing his eyebrows when he saw your search, “'How to make your son eat something other than waffles’?”

“You’d be surprised how many mothers have the same question as me,” Jin turned his head to his one and a half year old, sitting in his high chair in the kitchen and munching happily on his waffles, completely oblivious to the fact that his parents were even in the room, “It’s not even that I want him to eat carrots, even though I’d be more than happy if he wanted something healthy for once. It’s just that he won’t eat ANYTHING other than waffles. It’s like me when I was pregnant with him.”

“Only that you craved eggs and made me make you fried eggs at 3 in the morning.”

“Well, you were the one that got me pregnant, so…”

He grinned and kissed your forehead, before walking over to his son and crouching down in front of him.

“Jonwoo, do you want me to show you something really cool?” Your son looked up from his waffles and wanted to shove a piece of it into his father’s mouth, but Jin quickly got up and shook his head. “Here.. I’ll show you something.”

[[MORE]]

You watched him with curious eyes as he pulled several things out of the fridge and began randomly shoving them onto a skewer.

Jonwoo wasn’t interested, still munching on his waffles. Only when Jin pulled a chair towards his son and sat down in front of him, did he raise his head.

“The food that I cook is so good, that it gives you superpowers,” he held up the skewer, his son beginning to get semi-interested, “If you eat my food, it makes you so happy, watch,” he ate the first tomato off of it and munched just as happily as his son had on the waffles, before letting out a loud yum that had your son laugh out loud.

He made funny expressions, shook his head from side to side and eventually, Jonwoo reached for the skewer and began nibbling on the food that was on there.

Jin stood proudly before you, wiggling his eyebrows triumphantly at you, while you only looked at him with your arms crossed in front of your chest and a smirk sitting on your lips.

“Good job. Guess you’re the only one who’s making him dinner from now on, since only YOUR food has superpowers and not mommy’s.”

Ah well.. his plan had almost been perfect.

min yoongi

Yoongi was just so fucking tired.

His son had been up all night and even though you had tried to calm him down, a tummy ache was keeping him up till 5 AM. Normally that wouldn’t be too bad, he’d just take it easy the next day, but they were having a performance today.

And to say he was running on caffeine would be an understatement, because he couldn’t even remember how many coffees he has actually had.

“You okay?” Namjoon knelt down in front of his friend and band member, putting his hand on his shoulder.

“Yeah, yeah, I’m fine,” he mumbled.

He tried to focus on what Namjoon and the others said, but he could barely keep his eyes open, much less focus on anything other than staying awake.

And then that little monster (even if he loved him with all his heart) actually had the audacity to showed up.

“DADDY!” he ran towards him with his tiny feet and jumped into his arms.

“What are you..-” he looked up at you, who looked just as bad and exhausted as he did, maybe even a little worse, since you were always the one getting up in the middle of the night.

“He wanted to see you perform.”

“Did you not think you should have told me that?” he got up from the floor and grabbed your arm, pulling you to a secluded area, “There’s going to be cameras everywhere.”

“Yoongi..,” you smiled sweetly at him, but he could tell that it was fake, your lids dangerously close to dropping, “I haven’t had a good night’s rest in more than 72 hours. I can’t deal with a crying toddler right now. So if he wants to see daddy, he’s going to see daddy.”

“Fine,” he sighed, “But stay backstage and don’t let him come anywhere near the cameras!”

“Yes, Sir.”

“And don’t say Sir when we’re not alone, you know what that does to me,” he hissed under his breath, “Or do you want to have another one of these?”

As tired as you were, the sight of your son cuddled against his father’s chest actually did made you want to have a second one.. but maybe when he was older.. and not keeping you up as long as he did now.

jung hoseok

“Can you see daddy?” you whispered and she proudly pointed at Hoseok, “Good job, baby.”

It took Hoseok around five minutes before his eyes finally landed on you two, his entire face immediately lighting up.

Hope waved happily at him, her smile exactly the same as his and just as big.

“Can I go to daddy?”

“No, love, he’s still working. You can go to him when he’s done.”

“Oh,” she began to pout and then her lower lip began trembling and you knew that if you didn’t do something quickly, she’d end up sobbing in here and that was the last thing you wanted. It wasn’t that she was bratty, Hope had never been that. It was just that her father meant everything to her. Literally. So when she was so close to him, but wasn’t allowed to get hugs and kisses? That hurt her..

As if one look towards your boyfriend was enough, he immediately understood and began making hearts and funny faces for his kid and it didn’t take more then ten seconds, before she was laughing wholeheartedly again.

And when she was finally allowed to run to him and get the kisses and hugs she so desperately wanted, the world was fine again.

“You were so good today, baby.”

“I didn’t cry!” she said proudly.

“I saw that! You made mommy and daddy super proud,” he tickled her, before leaning towards you and pressing a kiss against your lips.

“Thank you,” you mouthed and he winked at you.

That was the definition of teamwork.

As tired as you were, the sight of your son cuddled against his father’s chest actually did made you want to have a second one.. but maybe when he was older.. and not keeping you up as long as he did now.

jung hoseok

Hope and you had just arrived at the fan sign, standing all the way in the back as to not pull too much attention towards you.

“Can you see daddy?” you whispered and she proudly pointed at Hoseok, “Good job, baby.”

You three wanted to grab lunch together, but you hadn’t known when he was actually done here, so you decided to go in and just watch for a while, show Hope how many people loved her father.

It took Hoseok around five minutes before his eyes finally landed on you two, his entire face immediately lighting up.

Hope waved happily at him, her smile exactly the same as his and just as big.

“Can I go to daddy?”

“No, love, he’s still working. You can go to him when he’s done.”

“Oh,” she began to pout and then her lower lip began trembling and you knew that if you didn’t do something quickly, she’d end up sobbing in here and that was the last thing you wanted. It wasn’t that she was bratty, Hope had never been that. It was just that her father meant everything to her. Literally. So when she was so close to him, but wasn’t allowed to get hugs and kisses? That hurt her..

As if one look towards your boyfriend was enough, he immediately understood and began making hearts and funny faces for his kid and it didn’t take more then ten seconds, before she was laughing wholeheartedly again.

And when she was finally allowed to run to him and get the kisses and hugs she so desperately wanted, the world was fine again.

“You were so good today, baby.”

“I didn’t cry!” she said proudly.

“I saw that! You made mommy and daddy super proud,” he tickled her, before leaning towards you and pressing a kiss against your lips.

“Thank you,” you mouthed and he winked at you.

That was the definition of teamwork.

kim namjoon

This was your first Christmas as parents, spending the holidays (or at least a couple of days) at Namjoons’ parents house, before you’d have to go back to Seoul, since he had to work again.

Most of his family was already in bed, after having stuffed themselves to the brim with how much his mother had cooked for everyone. All but Namjoon, who was sitting in front of the fireplace with a book in his hand, enjoying the rare quietness that being a father had taken away from him.

Not that he minded.

Of course balancing out the life of an idol, as well as a father was hard and stressful and even though he had been worried about it beforehand, he wouldn’t change his life for anything now. He now had a beautiful son that made his life a lot better and ever since two months ago, not just a girlfriend, but a fiance that he loved with all his heart.

Speaking of fiance.

“You should come to bed,” you smiled as you walked towards him with your oversized shirt (that was actually his), some shorts and fuzzy socks. A look that always made him fall in love all over again with you. You were holding your sleeping son in your arms, as you sat down in his lap, leaning against him

“Did he wake up again?”

“He was hungry,” you gently brushed over your baby’s soft cheek, “You’d think after your mother fed him so much he’d be good for a couple of hours.”

Namjoon laughed and pressed a kiss against your head, “He’s got a good appetite, I guess.”

For a moment, neither of you said anything. The only sound in the room was the crackling fire and the soft breathing of your son.

“Namjoon?” you asked after a while.

“Hm?”

“I want another baby.”

“What?” he let out a soft laugh, “What do you mean another one? We just had one.”

“I know.. and it’s probably stupid, but.. he’s growing up so fast..”

“(Y/N),” he began, “I want to have a big family with you, you know that. But I’m already missing out so much on his life.. I don’t want that to happen with our second child as well. I want to be there for you, every step of the way this time. And I don’t want to see my next kid grow up through my phone screen as well. It’s hard enough doing it now..”

You knew he was right. How hard it was for him to miss out on so much, just because he was away on tour or doing god knows what.

You were being selfish here.. you needed to wait, so that he could experience it all with you again. That was his right and you wouldn’t take that from him.. as much as you wanted to have another baby with him.

“I’m sorry.. you’re right.”

“We will have another baby.. just.. not now.”

“Okay..”

park jimin

Since his daughter was finally big enough to do stuff, you know, other than crying and pooping, he decided that this mother’s day, he’d finally bake a cake with her for you.

So he told you to stay in bed when the little one woke up, took her to the kitchen to have breakfast and then began baking with her.

Not that he had any idea on how to do it, but he had asked Jin beforehand, who had given him not only tips, but a recipe as well.

And to his surprise, his daughter actually did way better than himself and much better than he had expected.

She was the boss in the kitchen, telling him what to do and where to go and tried to most of it herself, already.

To say he was a proud father would not be enough. And after this, he was sure she’d be a cook one day.

“Here, daddy,” she held out a bowl, “Try it.”

He thought he’d have to fake it and tell her it was good when it actually wasn’t. Isn’t that what all parents did? When their kids drew paintings that looked horrible, they just smiled and said: ‘Good job!’. He was fully prepared to do the same thing, but then he actually tasted it and was amazed at how good it was.

He gave her a big thumbs up, “It tastes fantastic!”

She giggled, “Is mommy going to like it?”

“Definitely, love,” he kissed her forehead, “Especially because you made it.”

And so one and a half hours later, he entered your shared bedroom with a cake in his hand and his daughter.

“Mommy,” she whispered, as she sat on your chest, “Mommy wake up..”

“What.. what is it?” you mumbled, your hands on her legs, “Are you okay?”

“It’s mother’s day today! Daddy and I made you cake because we love you so much!” and with that, she cuddled against you, “You’re the best mommy in the world! And my baby brother will be so lucky to have you..”

It should be illegal to be this cute at this early hour, because you fully ended up crying.

Whether that was because of how thankful you were to Jimin and your daughter, or because your son in your belly made your hormones go wild.. who knows.

Jimin leaned down and pressed a kiss against your forehead, “Happy mother’s day to the most beautiful mother in the world.”

“I love you,” you whispered against his lips, “So much..”

“I love you too, Jagi..”

kim taehyung

“Daddy?” your daughter carefully pushed open the bedroom door and Taehyung immediately looked up from his laptop to smile at his daughter, “Can I come in?”

“Hmm..,” he pretended like he was thinking about it while getting up and walking over to her, before quickly picking her up and showering her with kisses, “Hopefully to cuddle?”

She giggled when he fell onto the bed with her, landing on his back, and she tried to wriggle out of his grasp, but he tightly held her in his arms, not wanting to stop kissing his beautiful baby girl just yet.

“Daddy! It’s important!”

“This is too!” he wanted to tickle her tummy, but she managed to jump away from him and suddenly yelled:

“I CUT SANGMIN’S HAIR AND NOW HE’S CRYING.”

That made the smile disappear at once.

“What?”

“Well,” she suddenly got super shy, looking at her hands and fidgeting with her fingers, “We were cutting my dolls hair and then I ran out of dolls..”

“You cut your brother’s hair because you ran out of dolls?! Kim Soyoung!”

“Daddy,” at the touch of a button, his son entered the room, his face red and puffy from all the crying.

This is what happened when you were out for a day and he was left with his twin toddlers. It all went to shit. He still remembered the conversation he and you have had this morning, when he told you to enjoy your day with your girlfriends and that he’d handle everything. And that when you’d come home, everything would be the same it was when you had left. 

And now his son was left with a horrible haircut.

“Show me,” Taehyung winked him over and helped him sit on the bed, inspecting the damage his twin sister had caused. She had cut a bit at the back, but it didn’t look too bad, actually. He had thought he would have half of his hair chopped of. This, he may be able to fix, “It’s not too bad, Sangmin.”

“See? I told you,” one look from her father was enough to have Soyoung stop talking and lower her head in shame once more.

“I’ll tell you what. How about.. we cut daddy’s hair just like that too! And when mommy comes home, she won’t even notice,” of course that wasn’t really what he had planned. He’d cut off a bit of his own hair, but he’d mostly fix what his daughter had caused.

Sangmin nodded, not fully happy with it, but he still cuddled into his father’s chest and let him carry the boy into the bathroom. Soyoung wanted to fix it herself, but he felt like she’d only make it worse if she did. 

And when you got home later that night and your jaw hung open when you saw both your son and husband with a new hairstyle that they clearly cut themselves, he just brushed his hand through the damp strands and nervously licked his lips.

“It’s not too bad, I promise.”

jeon jeongguk

Both you and Jeongguk woke up to the screams of your daughter. For the fourth time this night. The first time, she was hungry, then you had to change her diapers and then she wanted to eat again. But now neither of these two things seemed to be the problem and when she just wouldn’t stop crying, you got out of bed and wanted to walk around the apartment, hoping it would calm her down a bit.

“No.. don’t go,” Jeongguk instantly sat up.

“You need to sleep.”

“You do too.”

You sighed, not having the energy to argue, and laid back down, placing your newborn baby between you two, both you and his hand gently stroking her body.

It’s been two months, and you were both still so utterly lost as parents. You both tried your hardest, but every time something like this happened, you just wanted to cry, because you had no idea what was wrong with her and she obviously couldn’t just tell you.

Despite all, you still loved her both with all your heart. That made it a bit easier.

Suddenly, Jeongguk began humming one of their new songs, while his fingertips brushed over her tiny nose, her forehead and her cheeks. And eventually he began singing.

It was The Truth Untold, but a very, very soft version. He turned it into a lullaby and the second your baby girl heard his voice, she calmed down.

It was like magic.

Her teary eyes were now big, staring up at her father and watching him sing line after line. And she wasn’t the only one entranced. You were too.

And while your daughter stopped crying, you were the one that started, even though quietly. Because you were just so.. exhausted and stressed. You thought everything you were doing was wrong and you were a horrible mother. You thought that maybe you should have given her up and she would have had a better life, because you just didn’t seem to be doing anything right, as much as you tried. But through all of it, Jeongguk stayed by your side. Even though his busy schedule should have him sleep most of the day if he had free time, he spent the day with you and your daughter. He always made sure that you were both alright and he never complained about anything.

Not once.

And it was moments like these that it all came crashing down and you just couldn’t keep it together anymore.

While his daughter’s eyes slowly dropped again and he sang her back to sleep, he reached out to you and gently caressed your cheek, wiping away the tears, but never stopping to sing.

And then he ended the song with a gentle: “And I still want you..”

kim seokjin

“What are you googling?” he placed his chin on your head, furrowing his eyebrows when he saw your search, “'How to make your son eat something other than waffles’?”

“You’d be surprised how many mothers have the same question as me,” Jin turned his head to his one and a half year old, sitting in his high chair in the kitchen and munching happily on his waffles, completely oblivious to the fact that his parents were even in the room, “It’s not even that I want him to eat carrots, even though I’d be more than happy if he wanted something healthy for once. It’s just that he won’t eat ANYTHING other than waffles. It’s like me when I was pregnant with him.”

“Only that you craved eggs and made me make you fried eggs at 3 in the morning.”

“Well, you were the one that got me pregnant, so…”

He grinned and kissed your forehead, before walking over to his son and crouching down in front of him.

“Jonwoo, do you want me to show you something really cool?” Your son looked up from his waffles and wanted to shove a piece of it into his father’s mouth, but Jin quickly got up and shook his head. “Here.. I’ll show you something.”

summary: BTS, Seungri, BLACKPINK, ASTRO, KARD, And More Grab Spots On Billboard's World Albums Chart
title: BTS, Seungri, BLACKPINK, ASTRO, KARD, And More Grab Spots On Billboard's World Albums Chart
body:
BTS, Seungri, BLACKPINK, ASTRO, KARD, And More Grab Spots On Billboard’s World Albums Chart

Billboard has released its World Albums chart for the week ending in August 4!

BTS remains in the top two spots on the chart once again. “Love Yourself: Tear” is in first place in its 10th week on the chart overall, and “Love Yourself: Her” follows at No. 2 in its 45th week on the chart.

BIGBANG member Seungri’s new album “The Great Seungri” enters the chart at No. 3. It features the title track “
